PN.content:
Please identify the "Property Name" entities in the following paragraph.

Paragraph: All polymers showed very deep HOMO levels of ca.

Let's think step by step.

1. "HOMO levels": Hole Orbital Energy Level is a property of a molecule or a material, specifically related to its electronic structure. It represents the energy required to remove the highest occupied molecular orbital (HOMO) electron from the molecule or material. Therefore, "HOMO levels" is the property name in this context.
Please remove irrelevant entities and only keep the entities that clearly refer to Material Property.
Property Name: HOMO levels (relates to the energy levels of the material's highest occupied molecular orbitals)

Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Property Name".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

PV.content:
Please identify the "Property Value" entities in the following paragraph.

Paragraph: All polymers showed very deep HOMO levels of ca.

Let's think step by step.

1. "HOMO levels": This is a property value related to the electronic structure of polymers. HOMO stands for Highest Occupied Molecular Orbital, which is an energy level in a molecule where the valence electrons reside. The value given, "ca.," indicates an approximate value.
Please remove irrelevant entities and only keep the entities that clearly refer to Value of Material Property.

Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Property Value".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

| Property Value |
| --- |
| HOMO levels (of polymers) |
| ca. |

Note: Since "ca." is an approximation of a value, it is included as part of the "Property Value" for this example.
